intro: Mentha weissenburgensis, commonly known as the Whiteburg mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to central and southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that have a distinctive minty fragrance. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, appearing in whorls along the stems. Mentha weissenburgensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
